bonemarrow_heading: What are the types of Bone Marrow Transplant?
bonemarrow_dose: Autologous Bone Marrow Transplant - Marrow cells are collected from the patient’s own body and transfused back after high dose chemotherapy.
bonemarrow_donor: Allogenic Bone Marrow Transplant (Matched Sibling Donor) – Replacement of diseased or defective marrow with marrow from a genetically (HLA) matched sibling donor.
bonemarrow_marrowcells: Autologous Bone Marrow Transplant - Marrow cells are collected from the patient’s own body and transfused back after high dose chemotherapy.
bonemarrow_location: Allogenic Bone Marrow Transplant (Matched Unrelated Donor) – Replacement of diseased or defective marrow with marrow from a genetically (HLA) matched donor obtained from bone marrow registries in India and abroad.
bonemarrow_parent: Haplo-Identical Bone Marrow Transplant - Replacement of diseased or defective marrow with marrow from the parent.
bonemarrow_umbilical: Umbilical cord Bone Marrow Transplant - Replacement of diseased or defective marrow with marrow from a genetically (HLA) matched umbilical cord donor obtained from umbilical cord registries in India and abroad.
